跕字的基本解释

跕
diǎn
同“踮”。

跕
tiē
拖着鞋走路。

跕
dié
下坠的样子。

跕字的汉语字典释义

[①]［tiē］
［《廣韻》他協切，入帖，透。］
(1)拖着鞋，足尖轻着地而行。
(2)紧靠；挨近。
[②]［dié］
［《廣韻》丁愜切，入帖，端。］
(1)坠落。
(2)引申为贬黜。
(3)垂挂。
(4)缓行。
(5)家声词。参见“跕2跕”。
[③]［zhàn］
(1)站立。
(2)犹站。驿站；粮站。
(3)指途中暂驻之处。
[④]［diǎn］
同“踮1”。
抬起脚后跟用脚尖站着。

跕字的康熙字典解释

【酉集中】【足字部】　跕； 康熙笔画：12； 页码：页1223第29
【廣韻】他協切【集韻】託協切，?音帖。【玉篇】跕，履也。【史記·貨殖傳】爲娼優女子則鳴瑟跕屣。【註】躡跟爲跕也。【前漢·地理志】彈弦跕躧。【註】躧與屣同，謂小履之無跟者也。跕謂輕躡之也。　又【廣韻】丁愜切【集韻】【韻會】的協切【正韻】丁協切，?音喋。墮落也。【後漢·馬援傳】仰視飛鳶，跕跕墮水中。【註】跕跕，墮貌也。　又【類篇】一曰徐行。

跕字的源字形

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
跕字的起名意思

暂无。

Tiptoe
Basic explanation of words
Tiptoe
diǎn
Same as "tip".
Tiptoe
tiē
Walking with shoes.
Tiptoe
dié
The appearance of falling.
Tiptoe
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①] [tiē]
["Guang Yun" he co-cuts, enters the post, and is thorough. ]
(1) Drag your shoes and walk with your toes lightly on the ground.
(2) Close to; close to.
[②]［dié］
["Guangyun" Ding Qie cut, enter the post, end. ]
(1) Falling.
(2) The extension is derogation.
(3) Hanging.
(4) Slow travel.
(5) Family consonants. See "Tie 2 Tie".
[③]［zhàn］
(1) Standing.
(2) Still station. Post station; grain station.
(3) Refers to a temporary stop on the way.
[④]［diǎn］
Same as "Stand 1".
Raise your heels and stand on your toes.
Tiptoe
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
【Youth Collection】【Foot Character Department】　踮; Kangxi Strokes: 12; Page Number: Page 1223 29
[Guang Yun] He Xieqie [Jiyun] Support Xieqie, audio note. [Jade articles] stand on tiptoe, walk on it. [Historical Records · Huo Shi Chuan] As a prostitute, it will be on the tiptoe. [Note] The tiptoe is also a tiptoe. [Pre-Han Geography] Play the strings on tiptoe. [Note] Zhe and Qi are the same, it is said that there is no follower of Xiaolu. On tiptoe that is also light.　[Guangyun] Ding Xieqie [Jiyun] [Yunhui]’s Xieqie [Zhengyun] Ding Xieqie,? Yinchae. Depravity too. [Later Han·Ma Yuan Biography] Looking up at Feiyi, standing on tiptoe into the water. [Note] Standing on tiptoe, degenerate appearance.　[Classes] One said Xu Xing.
